poem.title: Church on the River Nerl 1981
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The film is cockroach brittle, this print Has tints of the sink it slid from, Vitreous china sky, like my little eye, Awash with floaters. Yet I've spent this night firm planted Like fishermen that day Corkscrew drill and hip flask, hunched Evangelists. What I saw there was a share of perpetual light And absent faces that Gaze through my soul with eyes of stone.
